You start out at the Accounts screen. It shows you a quick overview of all your worth.

Long pressing an account lets you edit account details and delete the account.

The Preference menu button contains help, video tutorials, and settings such as password protection.

The View-Options menu button contains options for what accounts or the type of balance to display.

In the Account Info screen you can enter as much or as little information as you would like. Entering the Account name on the first line is the only item required for a new account.

Use Fee for those pesky charges when you use an out of network ATM.

Limit can be the upper limit for a credit card account, or an minimum balance level for a bank account. Type determines how Limit is handled.

Lastly, a general purpose notes field for whatever other data you might want to track.

Your first account is now listed on the Accounts screen.

To the far left is the Total Worth checkbox. The balance at the bottom of the screen is calculated only on the accounts that have Total Worth checked.

Tap Edit and select the account to go back to the Account Info screen.

Selecting the account name or icon will open up the list of transactions for the account.

Pressing the plus symbol is a shortcut to create a transaction without having to open the transaction register first.

Let's open the transaction register for the account you just created. Go ahead and tap %1$s.

Lots of stuff here. We'll go into a bit of detail, so lets dig in.

A bit of history: Since PocketMoney was released for Apple's Newton 15+ years ago, it has always used Withdrawal, Deposit, and Transfer to signify the transaction type. Other applications might have 10 different ways to say what boils down to three things you can do with your money.

Withdrawal - you are giving money to someone. Writing a check to your hair dresser, paying for gas with your credit card…

Deposit - you are getting money from someone. Your paycheck, a refund on your taxes…

Transfer - you are moving money between two of your accounts. Transferring money from your checking account to your credit card account.

Opening Balances: For Bank, Cash, and Asset accounts you'll create a Deposit for you initial balance. For a Credit Card and Liability accounts you'll create a Withdrawal.

The amount is the only thing you need to fill in, but even that is optional. 

Entering To and Category fields is a good idea so you can chart your spending based on categories.

Class is used by some users for classifying expenses.

+Fee creates a transaction with the amount set to the Fee from the Account Info if you set it.

You probably want to view All accounts unless you are tracking dozens of accounts, in which case…

Non Zero will only display accounts with a non zero balance.

Total Worth will only display accounts that are checked.

There are a few interesting options for what balance is displayed in the bar at the bottom of the Accounts, Transactions, and Edit Transaction screens.

Current Balance is the default. It's the total amount of money in your account.

Cleared Balance is the amount of money in the account where you have marked the transaction cleared. Typically, when you get your monthly account statement you would verify what you have entered into PocketMoney with what the bank thinks you did - anything that has cleared the bank you would mark as cleared.

Current Balance is the balance as of Now. If you enter transactions with a date in the future (upcoming bills, next Friday's salary…), then Current Balance will not include these future transactions in its balance calculation.

Available Credit is how much credit you have left on your credit cards and credit line accounts.

Did I really spend that much on X?

Reports give you a handy way to analyze what you've spent money on. The report defaults to a list view. Anything checked will be included in the Expenses total and included in the pie chart.

If you want to a break down of an expense line, press it and it will show you a list of transactions.

A very handy trick is to choose a Category Report, pick an expense for example Food, then look at the Payee Report based on Food to show you a break down of where you spent your money on Food.

The account type for this account is set to \'Online\'. \'Online\' account types will open the website you specify in the website field of the Account Info screen for this account. The url must start with http:// or https://.

Pick the type that best matches your account.

Asset: Use for things like frequent flyer mileage or other assets that you want to track.

Cash: Use for cash types of accounts.

Liabilities: Used for things like loans or accounts receivables.

Online: This is a special type of account. If you set the account type to Online, then set the website to your bank or credit card online banking website. PocketMoney doesn't support real online banking, but by entering your online banking accounts in PocketMoney it will let you keep all the accounts together. Instead of going to the list of transactions in PocketMoney when you tap on the account name like other account types, PocketMoney will open the website you enter so that you can log in. This is similar to how the current Bank of America application on AppStore works.
i file(s) received successfully. Please quit and relaunch PocketMoney to complete the import/restore process.
There were no files to be uploaded or downloaded.\n\nIf you are trying to download QIF files, make sure the file ends with the .qif extension
Password and confirmation do not match. Password remains unchanged.

The lite version of PocketMoney only allows two accounts and five budget items to be tracked, and two repeating transactions to be created.\n\nPurchase the full version of PocketMoney for unlimited accounts, budget items, and repeating transactions; split transactions, custom searches, and more.

The lite version of PocketMoney only allows two accounts and two repeating transactions to be created.\n\nPurchase the full version of PocketMoney for unlimited accounts and repeating transactions; custom searches, and more.
The account must be selected before you can save a transaction.
This feature requires an active wi-fi network connection. Make sure you have your wi-fi turned on.

Budgeting can help you plan and control your spending.

The Edit button lets you edit budget category details and delete categories.

Go ahead and press the 'Edit' button to list all the budget categories. Tapping on a category from the Edit screen will open an editor screen for the category so you can set your budget limit. Set as many budget limits as you wish to track. Tap Done and the Budgets screen will show all the categories you are tracking budgets for. If a category has transactions associated with it, tapping on the category line will open a transaction register showing all transactions for that category.

The Balance/Available/Budgeted column heading can be tapped to change what is displayed - balance is the amount you are over or under budget; available is the amount under budget you are, if you are over budget it shows zero available; budgeted is the amount budgeted in that category.
This category has a budget associated with it.\n\nDelete from what?
This category has a budget associated with it.\n\nDeleting this will also delete the budget item?
Change in the popup lists only, or change everywhere?
How often this transaction repeats must be entered before you can save a repeating transaction.\n\nTap the blue circle to the right of the Date to configure the repeating info for this transaction.
To help you learn many of the features of PocketMoney, we\'ve created a series of video tutorials covering a variety of subjects.
The other end of this transfer has splits associated with it, so you must edit this transfer from the parent transaction.
Tap on the link above to post the transaction to PocketMoney.
Change the date of the transaction and repeating event, or change the date of only this transaction?

Invalid QIF file. Did not find any lines starting with \'!Type\'.\n\nTry adding \'!Type:Bank\' as the first line of the QIF file. If it already exists, then check that File Encoding is set correctly in PocketMoney\'s Preferences.
Unknown error processing the OFX/QFX file. Please contact support%1$scatamount.com.

When an account exceeds/drops below the Limit set in Account Info, then the balance will display in red and a red badge will appear on the PocketMoney icon on your Home screen showing the number of accounts below/above their limits.
This option is not support on this device.\nPlease update the OS.
Are you sure you want to delete %1$s?

PocketMoney can enter transactions for you that occur on a regular schedule.

To create bi-weekly repeating transactions set the frequency to weekly, and set Every to Every 2 Week(s).

Transactions that happen quarterly have a frequency of Monthly, and Every set to Every 3 Months(s).
You must quit and restart PocketMoney for the theme change to take effect.
Tap Edit to create and manage your accounts.
Tap + to create a new account.
Create a File for Each Account
This device is not able or not allowed to make payments. Verify your internet connection is active, and that In-App Purchases are enabled in your System Settings.
Includes Net Worth and Cash Flow summary charts to give you an overview of where you stand financially. Add pie, line, and bar chart options to your reports.
Enable Themes for a wider variety of colors and fonts. Color themes include Money Green, Silver Bullion, Royal Purple, and Coffee.
Never lose a receipt again. Attach up to 3 photos to each transaction. Store the receipt, warranty, image of the purchase, or whatever.
Husbands & wives keep your PocketMoney data in sync, or keep your iPhone in sync with your iPad. Buy now to enable the PM Sync Server on your iOS device.

Enter the address displayed below into a web browser on your computer. Click \'Choose file\' and select your PocketMoneyDB.sql database file (qif, ofx, csv, and tdf files can also be resotred). Then click on \'Submit\' to upload it. Upon returning from this page, the program needs to exit to apply the changes.\nWarning: Do not leave this screen while transferring data.

Enter the address displayed below into a web browser on your computer. Download the PocketMoneyDB.sql file to backup your PocketMoney data.\n\nWarning: Do not leave this screen while transferring data.

Toggling the total worth off will hide this account because Show Accounts in the Account View Options is set to show only Total Worth accounts.

If you have forgotten your password, then Reset Password will remove your password so you can access PocketMoney. To reset your password you need to buy the Reset Password In-App Purchase item. It will reset your password, and let you back into PocketMoney.
Enter the ip address and port of the PocketMoney Sync Server then press sync.\nWarning: Do not leave this screen while transferring data.
Press Start Server. On your other device enter this server\'s ip address and port.\nWarning: Do not leave this screen while transferring data.
First sync to device with UDID: %1$s
Another computer tried to connect, but there is already a connection open.
Leave name field blank. The Password is the password set in PocketMoney on your iPhone.
Received all recent changes. Processing them.
Client and server sync protocol mismatch. Update all versions of PocketMoney to the current version.
Connection seems to have been lost. Try again.

Processing of repeating transactions has been disabled. Only the device with PocketMoney acting as the server should have this feature active, otherwise multiple repeating transactions will be created. You can re-enable this in Preferences > Repeating Transactions.
Do you want to set the last export date to the current date and time?

Two things are needed to sync your data together a client and a server.

The server can be another iOS device running PocketMoney or the desktop version of PocketMoney (OS X, Windows, or Linux).

1. Start up the Server. If you are syncing between two iOS devices, then you will need to purchase PocketMoney Sync Server which is available through the in-app-purchase process.

2. On the client enter the server ip address and port, then tap Sync. 

* The first sync could take a while depending on how much data you have and is best done when you are on a wi-fi network. After the initial sync, future syncs will happen fairly quickly.

Repeating Transactions:
If you use repeating transactions, then you need to decide which device is going to be your main device. This device should be considered your "server". When the sync is complete the Post Scheduled Transaction will be turned OFF because having multiple copies of PocketMoney all processing all the repeating transactions will be messy.

Restore from
Restore will delete your current PocketMoney database and replace it with what is synched down.
Change the amount of the transaction and repeating event, or change the date of only this transaction?
